channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024071243
item.description:
Report X-2024071243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CAME TO DMP TO LET US KNOW THERE WAS A LEAKER IN DOOR 9. RESPONDER TOOK SPILL CART AND WENT TO RESPOND TO DOOOR 9. WHEN ENTERING TRAILER RESPONDER SAW A 5 PART LEAKING. TOOK LEAKER BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS

item.title: Report E-2024070393
item.description:
Report E-2024070393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-ounces of KEM TEK POOL & SPA CARE SWIMMING POOL MURIATIC ACID released from six (6) plastic jugs impacting the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with clean up. Clean Harbors neutralized and cleaned the impacted 5'X4' area of the trailer floor. Clean Harbors containerized the damaged cardboard and jugs into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the impacted absorbents and pallet into one (1) poly drum for disposal.
